column4: Hi! We're having troubles with accessing EC2 S3-based Ubuntu mirror: Failed to fetch http://us-east-1.ec2.archive.ubuntu.com.s3.amazonaws.com/ubuntu/pool/main/g/gcc-defaults/g++_4.5.2-1ubuntu3_amd64.deb 403 Forbidden
anybody might have an idea what can be wrong with it?
1: check if you can access it from another site, 2: tcptraceroute it.
essentially, we have it in automated build system in the cloud, and some (and only some) packages started to throw 403 couple of hours ago
and check if you can reach it from elsewhere. Also, do you use any proxy?
do you have an idea if Ubuntu EC2 S3 mirror is under maintenance now?
no, did you check the things I suggested?
tcptraceroute works, its some .deb files referenced in Packages file are gone from their location apparently
can you get those packages from other networks? (from the same mirror)
and I am not interested in if tcptraceroute "works", obviously you can reach the server if you get 403. However, maybe the route is different and the enpoint different. Maybe a transparent proxy?
not really, without lot of manual hacking around. again, it's automated system which "just works". or breaks ;-)
well, right now it has "broken", so you must do some manual debugging.
which automation system do you use?
and before doing any changes, I'd just like to know what's the status of us-east-1.ec2.archive.ubuntu.com.s3.amazonaws.com
ok, I do not know Jenkins. I use MetaConfig myself ( http://www.metaconfig.com )
any hints about Ubuntu EC2 S3 mirror status, like "it is known to work as of now"/"it is known not to work"/"i don't know"? thanks.
I do not know. I use a different mirror. Try asking your vendor?
